meanings.definition: To give a name or nickname to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys dubbing her stuffed animals with funny names.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is dubbing each student with a superhero nickname.
meanings.sent3: The cat dubbing the new plant 'Leafy' made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The chef dubbing the dish 'Flavor Explosion' was a stroke of genius.
meanings.sent5: Dubbing the mountain 'Majestic Peak' made it sound grand and impressive.

meanings.definition: To add a new soundtrack to a film or video.
meanings.sent1: The studio is dubbing the foreign film with English voices.
meanings.sent2: They are dubbing the movie to make it more accessible to viewers.
meanings.sent3: Dubbing the horror movie with funny sound effects was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The team is dubbing the documentary with emotional music for impact.
meanings.sent5: Dubbing the action scene with intense music heightened the excitement.

meanings.definition: To strike lightly with a sword in bestowing knighthood.
meanings.sent1: The king will be dubbing the brave knight with his sword.
meanings.sent2: In the ceremony, the queen will dub the new knight with honor.
meanings.sent3: Dubbing the young squire on the shoulder was a tradition full of pride.
meanings.sent4: The master swordsman dubbing the apprentice was a moment of great respect.
meanings.sent5: The act of dubbing the warrior symbolized his new status and role.
